title: Understanding Audience Engagement
text: Think about where a listener’s focus should be during a presentation. What are they ideally engaging with?

title: Focusing on the Speaker
text: Consider the difference between consuming information passively from a slide and actively listening to a speaker. Which one might be more effective for conveying the speaker’s message?

title: The Role of Visual Aids
text: Visual aids are there to support your message, not replace it. What impact might reading have on your audience's attention during your talk?

hintAnswer: If they're reading, they're not listening, and that means your message isn't getting through.
title: Finding the Right Balance
text: Consider the effects on your communication if your audience is busy with reading instead of listening.
choices: If they're reading, they're not listening, and that means your message isn't getting through.
Your audience will be very tired by the end of the presentation, so you won't have as active a Q&A session.
If they're reading, they'll miss the visuals.
The visuals and the text might say different things, so you need to explain that context to them.
